etymology.description: semantic: 金 (“metal”) + phonetic: 艮; simplified: 金 → 钅
etymology.interpretation: 金 (jīn, metal) signals that the meaning relates to metal, while 艮 (gèn, stubborn/stop; also a phonetic) guides the pronunciation toward yín. As a precious metal widely used as currency, it appears in words like 银行 (yínháng, bank).
etymology.simplification: Left-side metal radical 金 was simplified to 钅 under the mainland scheme, yielding 银 while keeping the phonetic 艮 unchanged.

examples.chinese: 白银价格上涨(白銀價格上漲)，投资者关注风险(投資者關注風險)。
examples.pinyin: Báiyín jiàgé shàngzhǎng, tóuzīzhě guānzhù fēngxiǎn.
examples.english: The price of silver rose, and investors are watching the risks.

examples.chinese: 我在银行换了一些美元(我在銀行換了一些美元)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài yínháng huàn le yīxiē Měiyuán.
examples.english: I exchanged some U.S. dollars at the bank.

examples.chinese: 这枚戒指是银制的(這枚戒指是銀製的)，很有质感(很有質感)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè méi jièzhǐ shì yínzhì de, hěn yǒu zhìgǎn.
examples.english: This ring is made of silver and has a nice texture.
